title: PHPpclose()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPpclose()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Open and close a pipe to the program specified in the
command
parameter:
<?php
$file = popen("/bin/ls","r");
//some code to be executed
pclose($file);
?>
Definition and Usage
The pclose() function closes a pipe opened by
popen()
.
Syntax
pclose(
pipe
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
pipe
Required. Specifies the pipe opened by popen()
Technical Details
Return Value:
The termination status, -1 on failure
PHP Version:
4.0+

★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:

//some code to be executed

summary: This tutorial covers PHPpclose()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPpclose()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPpclose()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
